description: Creativity was one of the characteristics humanity was always proud of. With recent technological advancements, machines are starting to get good at creating not only useful, but sensical and beautiful things. It looks like almost every domain where humans create original work — from advertising to literature, from coding to graphics, from marketing to law — is up for reinvention. Would Generative AI become not just faster and cheaper, but a better alternative to human hands and minds? How would it affect the creative process? We will discuss these questions, look at limitations and perspectives and build generative AI models.
title: Deus Ex Machina  Generative AI and Society
